details.description: A sample solution is created by "cherry picking" the best elements from a range of student submissions. The composite solution provides a clear and concrete indication of best practice. It should however be pointed out that this may not be a "perfect" solution, just the "best in class"
details.applicability: Works well with a convergent exercise, where the samples selected are relevant to all students.
details.consequences: Lack of coherence in the composite sample solution can sometimes confuse less able students. Can lead to competition between students (who will be selected for inclusion in the sample solution)
